newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Prince Charles arrives on two-day trip to Belgium.
newsitem.headline: Prince Charles arrives on two-day trip to Belgium.

text.p: Britain's Prince Charles arrived in Brussels on Tuesday for a two-day official visit to Belgium which includes a trip to the headquarters of Imperial Chemical Industries (ICI) Europe and an agricultural seminar.

Charles, well-known for his interest in environmental matters, will be shown ICI technology which turns agricultural waste products like straw, sugar cane and rice hulls into composite panels that can be used like wooden boards.

On Wednesday the prince takes part in a private conference by European Union lobbyists the Agricultural Reform Group and later meets Prince Philippe, the eldest son of King Albert and heir to the Belgian throne.
Charles, who last visited Belgium in 1992, has been farming organically at his Highgrove estate in the west of England for the last 11 years.
Only last month he attacked intensive farming methods and the genetic engineering of food, saying man's desire for cheap food had caused immense damage to the environment.
